Name: B-movie
Description:
Hire the best Hollywood actors for your next horror movie. But the other directors will try to make you recruit nerds to keep the stars! B-Movie is an original bluff game, it’s not you who are bluffing others, but them who are trying to trick you!

There are 5 families of 8 actor cards with values â€‹â€‹ranging from -4 to + 5. The players have two actor cards in hand, but only see their backs. They don't know his family or his worth. On your turn, you must propose an actor from your hand to the other players, who can accept or refuse to engage him.

If all players give the same answer (only YES or NO) he can give the card to any player. If both answers are present, he can only give the card to a player who answers yes. In all cases, he can keep the card to himself.

Name: CDG Solo System
Description:
The CDG Solo System is a revised GMT Edition of Stuka Joe's CDG solo method, which streamlines two-handed solitaire gameplay by decreasing turn to turn overhead and maintenance. This method of play increases narrative immersion as the great battles of history unfold on your tabletop. The GMT edition of the CDG Solo System includes professionally printed components, a custom screen-printed die, an official ruleset, and Playsheets for six of GMT’s most popular Card Driven Games.

Gameplay Overview
The CDG Solo System plays alongside your favorite CDG and is designed to enhance your solitaire experience by reintroducing many of the best parts of wargaming that fall apart in standard two-handed play, namely, as Stuka Joe mentioned above, the narrative flow and the fog of war.

The CDG Solo System includes two Card Displays that are used to manage each side’s hand of strategy cards. At the beginning of each Side's turn, you will roll a Fate Die to determine which of the cards in one or more of the slots are available for play. Typically 2 or 3 cards are available at a time, but the final decision is ultimately yours. After a card is played, the marker on the Cards Remaining track slides one spot to the left, and then it’s time to roll the die for the other side’s turn.

-description from the publisher

Name: Kingdom of Italy
Description:
RECREATE ITALY’S SOCIAL REVOLUTION (1861 - 1945)

As a powerful leader during Italy's tumultuous social revolution (1861-1946) wisely choose leaders, causes, and adapt to your opponent's tactics to win. Support Italy's King, Pope, and Prime Minister to gain control of a newly unified Italy. Devise clever strategies for creating your political, economic, and military power base. Grow your power by adding cities and their resources, appointing political leaders, and leading military attacks.

BUT BEWARE!

Enemies may implement their own military, political, or economic strategies to exploit your weaknesses. Allies may turn into enemies, deposing your leaders, instigating revolts in your cities, taking your income and might.

Kingdom of Italy realistically reenacts the turmoil and tactics from Italy’s past - bringing a totally new level of competitiveness to card games. Diplomacy, risk-taking, military planning, deception, and a sudden turn of fortune are all viable approaches for gaining the upper hand.

COURSE OF PLAY

Players seek to become the dominant faction in Italian politics and society through building and managing a tableau of allied Cities with attached Leaders, Military Forces, Spies, and Resources, represented by cards.  Players are each dealt a hand of cards and take turns playing Cities and attaching other cards to them as allowed, drawing additional cards at the end of each turn.  Players can potentially switch Cities' alliances through the influence of Leaders or seize them by force through military campaigns resolved through a combination of card and dice play.  The game ends once all cards are drawn.  The winner is determined based on total points scored in their tableau with different cards having different values.

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Doomwolf
Description:
A new monster card for Battle for Greyport.

The promo card comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 1

Damage: 1
Title: Doomwolf
Hit Points: 10
Text Box: When Doomwolf deals damage to a player, each player also discards a card.
Threat: 2
Faction: Beasts

Name: Que Ves II
Description:
OBJETIVO DEL JUEGO: Ser el primero en deducir cuatro sacertijos de las tarjetas de rebus y obtener 4 puntos.

PREPARACIÓN: Antes de comenzar se mezclan las 200 tarjetas y se colocan en el centro de la mesa con el acertijo mirando hacia arriba. EL reloj de arena deberá ocupar también el centro de la mesa junto a las tarjetas durante toda la partida.

CÓMO JUGAR: Comienza el juego el más joven del grupo. Su compañero de la derecha tomará la 1er tarjeta del mazo y le enseñará la imagen del acertijo sin mostrarle la respuesta, e inmediatamente dará vuelta el reloj. Si el jugador deduce el acertijo (concepto, frase o palabra) antes de que se cumpla el tiempo, se quedará con la tarjeta y obtiene 1 punto. Si no responde correctamente, la tarjeta se devuelve al fondo del mazo, sin que se muestre la respuesta. La ronda continúa en el sentido de las agujas del reloj de la misma forma con el resto de los jugadores.

TARJETAS "QUÉ VES PARA TODOS" (para todos los jugadores): Qué ves incluye un conjunto de tarjetas que están marca-das con EL REY en color rojo. En caso que a un jugador le toque una de ellas, perderá la oportunidad de descifrar esa tarjeta en esa ronda y deberá mostrarla al resto de los participantes. Luego de dar vuelta el reloj, el primero en responder correctamente se lleva la tarjeta obteniendo 1 punto. 
En cambio, si ninguno de los participantes logra descifrar el acertijo, se lleva la tarjeta el jugador que la extrajo del mazo y suma 1 punto.

¿QUIÉN ES EL GANADOR? El primer jugador en descifrar 4 acertijos y obtener 4 puntos, es el ganador.


OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME: Be the first player to decipher 4 riddles.

PREPARATION: The deck (all 200 cards) is shuffled and placed in the center of the table with the riddles facing up. The hourglass must also occupy the center of the table, next to the cards, throughout the game.

HOW TO PLAY: The youngest player begins the game. The player to his/her right will take the top card from the deck and show him/her the picture-riddle, without showing him/her the answer, and will immediately turn the hourglass. If the player deciphers the riddle (concept, phrase or word) before the time is up, s/he will keep the card and get 1 point. If he does not answer correctly, the card is returned to the bottom of the deck, without the answer being shown. The round continues clockwise in the same way with the rest of the players.

"WHAT YOU SEE, FOR EVERYONE" CARDS: The game includes a set of cards that are marked with the king in RED. If a player gets one of them, s/he will lose the opportunity to decipher that card in that round and must instead show it to the rest of the players. After turning the hourglass, the first player to answer correctly takes the card, obtaining 1 point. On the other hand, if none of the players manages to decipher the puzzle, the player who extracted the card from the deck takes it and gets 1 point for him/herself.

WHO IS THE WINNER?: The first player to decipher 4 puzzles (get 4 points) is the winner.

-from the game's official rulebook

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Dragon Breath Ale
Description:
A new item card for Battle for Greyport.

The promo card comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 1

Damage: White die
Title: Dragon Breath Ale
Type: Physical
Text Box:
   Combat ability: Splash yellow die
   Cleanup icon: Retire Dragon Breath Ale.
Recuitment Cost: Copper Coin

Name: Монополия: Казань
Description:
ÐœÐ¾Ð½Ð¾Ð¿Ð¾Ð»Ð¸Ñ: ÐšÐ°Ð·Ð°Ð½ÑŒ, Monopoly Kazan is a local version of Monopoly set in the city of Kazan in the Russian Republic of Tatarstan.

To win in Tatarstan, like anywhere else, do not get bankrupted!

Name: Charge of the Light Brigade: A Solitaire Wargame
Description:
Charge of the Light Brigade is a solitaire, tactical game depicting the Crimean War "charge of the noble 600" during the Battle of Balaclava, October 25th, 1854, made famous by Tennyson.

The game is low complexity, and emphasizes high playability and historicity.

As Lord Cardigan, commander of the British Light Brigade, you have received orders from your commander: attack the Russian position at the far end of the valley about a mile away. This involves running a gauntlet with enemy cannons to the left of you, to the right of you, and in front of you.

Your task seems like folly... but yours is not to reason, yours is but to do and die.  
The charge seems doomed from the start, but you do have the French Chasseurs d'Afrique on your left to possibly assist, and the Heavy Brigade behind you, so perhaps there is more chance to carry the opposition than at first appears?

Play the game, experience the situation, and find out.

The original orders: Lord Raglan wishes the cavalry to advance rapidly to the front, follow the enemy, and try and prevent the enemy carrying away the guns. Troop horse artillery may accompany. French cavalry is on your left. Immediate.  
Optional rules and scenarios allow you to explore various "what if?" interpretations of these orders, providing more strategy.

All you need to play the game (specifically designed for solo play) is:

     a standard deck of 52 playing cards,
     a six-sided die, and
     pencil.


Available separately or in Panzerschreck #18

—description from the publisher

Name: Auf Zack: Ergänzungsset
Description:
Over 500 new words for the game Auf Zack on 176 cards.

For the game Auf Zack (1992).

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Pariah Nexus
Description:
Focused on fighting it out in the confined battlegrounds of the Pariah Nexus, this expansion introduces new rules for close combat encounters in its claustrophobic depths. The box also features kill teams for the Space Marines and Necrons, both comprising brand new models. The Space Marines have sent a Captain with master-crafted heavy bolt rifle and five Heavy Intercessors to carry out this dangerous mission.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hampi & the Sun Jewel
Description:
Inspired by the historic city of Hampi in southern India, Hampi is a tile-laying game in which players build the landscape of Hampi from tiles that depict farms, roads, temples, ponds, markets and tiny villages. Each new tile placed creates an ever-expanding board on which players gather the support of the local people who know the secrets of the land. Players score points by completing the landscape. The player who makes the most strategic placements of tiles and gains the required support of the locals suiting the condition of the mystery Jewel wins the game.

The wise people of Hampi help in the searching for the Jewel. There are the miners, the priests, the elders, the merchants, the farmers, and the women. They express their support on the tile. Each tile scores support points differently, so, one needs to plan the placement of the tile carefully to gather the right support which determines the winner. You have a limited number of wooden markers that you use to complete your zone. Once placed, you don't get them back until the zone they're on is completed. You'll need to consider whether to go for small zones of quick support or work toward support points that really matter for you to win the Jewel.

Early in the game, one seeker gets the Sun Jewel. But true to its nature, the Sun Jewel passes among the players and finally reaches its true seeker who has the right support of locals. So it is not about maximizing points but being mindful of whose support will lead you towards winning. Hampi provides plenty of ways to use your wit and outsmart fellow seekers.

As the landscape grows, so does the opportunity for players to disrupt each other’s plans. Everyone is adding to the same landscape and only seekers with the right support matching the condition of the Jewel will win. With its simple yet rich game mechanics and 96 tiles that can be configured into numerous combinations and possibilities.

-description from publisher

Name: Colt Super Express: The Time Travel Car
Description:
The Time Travel Car is placed in front of the locomotive and can be reached via "Move" action from the inside of the locomotive or its roof. You can also enter the Time Travel Car by being shot by another bandit who would have ejected you into it.

When a bandit enters the Time Travel Car, he or she gets moved to the end of the train (inside the last wagon) facing the locomotive.

After that put your cards that you already played back on your programming stack (in the same order as they were before) and replay them. (you may be the only player still performing actions)

If you enter the Time Travel Car a second time in one round you create a time paradox and will be eliminated from the game.

Name: Squelettos
Description:
The objective of Squelettos is to collect a sequence of cards depicting skeletons and display them in ascending order and hopefully from the same family too, to gain bonus points.
Players take turns flipping over as many cards as they want from the central deck, to choose the one to keep.
But the player that turns over 2 cards of the same colour loses his turn and the chance to keep any card from that round at all.

—user summary

Name: Que Ves Junior
Description:
OBJETIVO DEL JUEGO: Ser el primero en deducir 4 acertijos de las tarjetas de rebus.

PREPARACIÓN: Antes de comenzar, se mezclan todas las tarjetas y se colocan en la bandeja (con la imagen hacia arriba), en el medio de los jugadores.

CÓMO JUGAR: Comienza el juego el más joven del grupo. Su compañero de la derecha, tomará una tarjeta del mazo y le enseñará la imagen del acertijo, sin mostrarle la respuesta. Si el jugador descubre el acertijo (concepto, frase o palabra) antes de que se cumpla 1 minuto, se queda con la tarjeta, y suma un punto. Si no acierta, la tarjeta vuelve al fondo del mazo de cartas (sin mostrar la respuesta) y continúa el juego de la misma manera, siguiendo la ronda en el sentido de las agujas del reloj.

Tarjetas "QUE VES para todos" (para más de dos jugadores): Hay un conjunto de tarjetas "Qué Ves" que están marcadas con el REY en color rojo. Si a un jugador le toca una de ellas, perderá la oportunidad de descifrar el acertijo en esa ronda, y deberán hacerlo los restantes jugadores. Si alguno de ellos acierta, se queda con la tarjeta. Si no, se la queda el jugador que tomó la tarjeta del mazo.

¿QUIÉN ES EL GANADOR? El primer jugador en descifrar 4 acertijos, gana la partida.


OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME: Be the first player to decipher 4 graphic riddles.

PREPARATION: The deck (all 150 cards) is shuffled and placed on the tray (image side up), in the center of the table.

HOW TO PLAY: The youngest player begins the game. The player to his/her right will take a card from the deck and show him/her the picture-riddle, without showing him/her the answer. If the player deciphers the riddle (concept, phrase or word) before 1 minute expires, s/he keeps the card, and scores a point. If s/he fails to solve the riddle, the card returns to the bottom of the deck (without the answer being shown) and the game continues, in a clockwise direction.

"WHAT YOU SEE, FOR EVERYONE" CARDS (for games with more than 2 players): The game includes a set of cards that are marked with the king in RED. If a player gets one of them, s/he will lose the opportunity to decipher that card in that round and must instead show it to the rest of the players. The first player to answer correctly takes the card, obtaining 1 point. If none of the players manages to decipher the puzzle, the player who took the card from the deck keeps it and gets 1 point for him/herself.

WHO IS THE WINNER? The first player to decipher 4 riddles (get 4 points) wins the game.

-from the game's official rulebook

Name: Vulture Capital
Description:
In Vulture Capital, you try to dump your junk assets into the open market. Taking cards is usually bad, so the object is to take as few cards as you can.

Players play several rounds, making blind bids that capture other cards, whether you want them or not! Each card you capture is one negative point (regardless of its rank) — unless you capture a full set (all the cards in one rank) in which case it's worth positive points equal to its rank.

The player with the highest score wins.

[Vulture Capital originally appeared as the "Venture" variant in PAIRS: Professor Elemental. Rights reverted back to the designer Daniel Solis.]
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Mixamino
Description:
In this game of logic, the players position the ants side by side, but beware... it isn't always easy to find your way around this ants' nest...

The aim of the game is to get as many ants on the 9x9 garden board as possible.

The game:
The player on his/her turn places one card adhering to the following rules:
- The card must connect to an already played card, the ants must connect.
- The card should not cover an anthill.
- The card must fit within the 9x9 board.

Then it's the next player's turn.

If one player is unable to place a card, the other player can continue until none of the players can play a card.

At the end of the round the players count the squares of the cards in front of them that have not been played. The player with the lowest number of squares wins a "points won" card.

The first player to have won 3 "points won" cards wins the game.

Name: Mackinaw
Description:
Mackinaw is a perfect information two-player abstract game where players stack and trap tokens while they try to move their pieces to the other side of the board. It is a variable board size game, the most accessible sizes being a 3x6 grid (9 pieces per side) or a 4x8 grid (16 pieces per side). Its closely related to checkers/draughts and can be played with flat tokens.

The object of the game is to move your pieces to the the other player's starting position (one piece in each square on the other side of the board). Players take turns moving one piece one space at a time, either forwards, left, or right, but not backwards or diagonal. You cannot undo a move you did on your last turn. Your piece may move on top of other pieces. The pieces underneath are trapped and cannot move until freed when the piece above moves off. If you have an available move you must take it, you cannot pass your turn. If you cannot move, your opponent may keep moving until a move becomes available. Once a piece passes the mid-line and lands in the opposite side of the board with no pieces beneath it, it is 'home' and cannot be moved again. The first player to get all their pieces 'home' wins the game.

Mackinaw was invented in 2019 by Tom Sutton, a Canadian animator and artist. It's name comes from the Ontario slang word for a checkered flannel coat; the first versions of the game were played with dark and light wooden blocks and often resembled the same pattern.

Name: My Hero Academia: League of Villains
Description:
Super Heroes vs, Villains in a Plus Ultra game experience that contains nearly 300 cards!

In My Hero Academia: League of Villains you must recruit super-powered Students and Heroes to your Agency. Select the best combinations of Quirks(super-powered abilities) to complete challenging Missions, defeat deadly Villains, save the world and become mightiest Agency around!

Name: Swearmints
Description:
Overview

Swearmints is a quick party game about making up new slang and defining it for your friends! Earn Mints by coming up with the best definitions!

Set Up

Start by choosing one person to be the Mint Master (or dealer) for the round.
Remove the cards from the tin and shuffle them lightly, but keep the mint cubes inside.
The Game

The Mint Master starts by dealing out 2 cards to all other players. Each card has 4 silly words on each side, so each player will have 16 words to play with.
All players must combine one word on each of their cards to form a new slang phrase and arrange it face up in front of them. (They cannot combine two words on the same card).
Once everyone is ready, each player must introduce their new slang phrase and tell the Mint Master what it means.
Scoring

After each player has defined their word, the Mint Master awards 1 Mint to their favorite new slang phrase, plus:

1 bonus Mint if that player used alliteration (two words with the same first letter, such as Boof Bucket) AND
1 bonus Mint if that player used a rhyme (such as Poot Boot).
The winner of the round may win anywhere from 1-3 mints based on their slang phrase.

Round End

Once the winner is chosen, all of the used cards are discarded, the Mint Master passes the tin clockwise, and you go back to the start. Re-shuffle as needed.
Play continues until the tin runs out of mints, and the person with the most mints wins. (If the tin has less mints then the last winner is owed, that winner gets ‘em all).
Try to incorporate your new favorite slang phrases into your everyday life!

—description from the publisher

Name: Pocket Pixel Artist
Description:
Welcome to Retro Game Jam. The annual pixel platformer design competition. Do you and your team have what it takes to design a retro game in under half an hour? well let's see you put your skills to the test!

In Pocket Pixel Artist, teams will compete against each other through a series of design challenges to see who can design and assemble the best pixel art graphics they can for a game jam submission! Against the clock, and only using small colored cubes, you must arrange them into 1 of 4 various game assets found on each card. (220 in total) if your team can correctly identify your creation you will gain points!

—description from the designer

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Protection Civile
Description:
Trivial Pursuit: Édition Protection Civile: is a French edition published on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the French Civil Protection (FNPC), a French humanitarian and first aid voluntary association.

Goal: be the first player to fill his pie-collector and go back to start position
Gameplay: move around (dice) and score points (cards)
Good/bad answers: if a player answers correctly, he/she gets to roll the dice again, if not, guess what...

Small size edition containing 330 questions / answers in 6 categories:

     Paris
     PSC1 (prévention et secours civiques de niveau 1 basic first aid training 
     Histoire - FNPC  (Fédération Ntionale de Protection Civile) - French Civil Protection
     PSE Certified First Responder
     Mystery
     Protection Civile de Paris, the association for Paris, Seine-Saint-Denis and Val-de-Marne

Name: Rhyme Antics
Description:
Players divide into teams.

The team that goes first will choose easy, intermediate, or difficult rhymes. A member of the opposing team draws a card and reads a target word corresponding to the difficulty level chosen. A timer starts (when using the app this will include a musical beat) and the team has one minute to say as many phrases as they can that end with a word that rhymes with the target word.

Points are received based on how many rhymes the team came up with and the difficulty level of the word they chose. Some specifically difficult rhymes appear on the card as bonus points, but any rhyming word is acceptable, even words not listed.

Then it is the other team's turn to do the same. Each team plays four rounds, and then the team that has the most points will be the winners.

Contents:
135 Playing Cards (Easy, Intermediate and Intellectual)
1 Scoreboard
2 Playing Card Clips
1 Microphone
1 Dry Erase Marker
1 60-Second Sand Timer

Name: Don't Judge Me
Description:
How well do your friends really know you? Read a question and see if other players can guess how YOU would answer. Questions range from provocative to ridiculous topics that will guarantee to lead to revealing stories.
Hilarious way to find out how much you know and don't know about other players. #dontjudgeme #safespace
Loaded with over 275 questions...play a card, have a conversation!

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Pz.Kpfw. IV Ausf. H
Description:
The Pz.Kpfw. IV (or Panzer IV) is an iconic German tank, a true workhorse of that saw use throughout the war. The Ausf. H version was introduced in 1943 and saw numerous improvements over previous versions, including improved firepower and protection, that allowed to continue to deal with even the heaviest Allied tanks.

The Pz.Kpfw. IV Ausf. H Expansion Pack contains the same model that players may have seen in the Starter Set. As a medium tank it has fairly middle-of-the-road stats, nothing that shines but nothing that is too bad either, but is versatile and with the addition of some cards can have its performance fine-tuned for the battlefield.

Speaking of cards, the Pz.Kpfw. IV Ausf. H comes with a new selection of options, not duplicating the ones from the Starter Set. Included in the pack is Jack Of All Trades which makes your Commander incredibly flexible, granting an Initiative bonus to the tank during either movement or shooting phase. Swap this over each turn depending on the situation, to ensure that you can either outmaneuver the enemy or get your shots off first!

Inside the Pz.Kpfw. IV Ausf. H Expansion Pack you will find a highly detailed, assembled, painted plastic Pz.Kpfw. IV Ausf. H miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalized to match your requirements using the five crew, module and upgrade cards included.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M4A1 Sherman
Description:
The M4A1 Sherman tank was, much like other releases in this wave, one of the most iconic tanks of the war. The Sherman first saw combat in the deserts of North Africa and continued to serve on battlefields till the end of the war in a variety of models.

The M4A1 Sherman Expansion Pack has the same model previously included in the Starter Set, but has been given a new lease on life through the inclusion of some new cards to let you turn this blank canvas of a tank into whatever you need it to be.

Whilst the M4A1 Sherman is a cost-effective tank with fairly average stats, it does have a good Initiative stat and by adding Relaying to your radio operator other tanks in the platoon can benefit from it during the Shooting Phase. Why stack a number of initiative buffs on each of your tanks when they may not need them each turn?  When you get just let your Sherman pass information off to them.

Inside the M4A1 Sherman Expansion Pack you will find a highly detailed, assembled, painted plastic M4A1 Sherman miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalized to match your requirements using the five crew, module and upgrade cards included.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – T-34
Description:
The T-34 tank was the cornerstone of Soviet armoured forces in World War II. Other tanks may have been lighter, better armed, or had a bigger gun, but there is only one T-34! When first encountered by German forces, they were shocked by just how good it was and scrambled to find ways to deal with the revolutionary design.

The T-34 Expansion Pack contains the same model that players may have seen in the Starter Set, but brings a new selection of cards to enhance the performance on the tabletop. The basic tank has excellent Mobility and good Initiative straight out of the box, allowing it to easily position itself anywhere on the battlefield.

This combination of stats makes the T-34 a natural hunter, able to pick out it’s prey and hunt it down. Adding Designated Target to your gunner can enhance this ability by allowing the tank to ignore a targets cover bonus, assuming it has already moved or shot.

Inside the T-34 Expansion Pack you will find a highly detailed, assembled, painted plastic T-34 miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalized to match your requirements using the five crew, module and upgrade cards included.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Cromwell
Description:
The Cromwell tank was one of a series of cruiser tanks fielded by the British in World War II. The concept of cruiser tanks was that they would combine speed with numbers, allowing the to swarm the enemy and overwhelm them. First deployed during the invasion of Normandy it found a natural home in the reconnaissance regiments where its excellent speed and low profile made it difficult to hit.

The Cromwell Expansion Pack includes the same great model from the Starter Set but has a new range of cards that you can use to equip and personalize your tank on the battlefield. Straight out of the pack, the Cromwell as excellent Mobility and the best base Initiative of any tank currently in the game.

Like the T-34 this combination of stats tends to make the Cromwell somewhat of an apex predator, able to hunt down other tanks with ease. Of course being awesome comes at a price, or in World of Tanks: Miniatures Game terms, a high Cost. This means you may not be able to afford many additional cards to equip your tank unless you plan ahead.

If you do want to enhance the natural stats of the tank there are some great options in the pack, including Vertical Stabilizer which helps to make the tank more accurate when moving slowly, that will work well to enhance this already formidable tank.

Inside the Cromwell Expansion Pack you will find a highly detailed, assembled, painted plastic Cromwell miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalized to match your requirements using the five crew, module and upgrade cards included.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: Slime Frontier
Description:
Once upon a time, there was a peaceful Elf Valley, containing treasurable power stones. Stones were protected by Elfs and they hid the Valley in mist as protection. However, the Valley was found by Devil Dragons and they invaded to plunder! Team up Slime hero! Call the Elfs and fight!

Cardgame with simple rule and tiny strategy. Good choice for family to have a great time.

Players have 3 actions that they can take on their turn in any order:

     Gather Resources (get Power stones from the market)
     Summon Slimes (use Power stones to gain slimes)
     Defeat a Dragon (use your slime army to try and defeat a dragon)


Points are gained for each dragon defeated. The final round is entered when any player gains 25 points at the end of the final round the player with the most points wins.

Name: The Game of Rescue
Description:
The Game of Rescue is one of a trio of games from Chad Valley's Kompactum Edition, circa 1910.

A simple roll and move sees up to 4 players race from the sea shore to reach a floundering masted boat in rough sea. Along the way the rescue team can be hampered or favoured by landing on specific squares. First to reach the sinking vessel on square 30 is the winner.

The game probably came boxed with two other Chad Valley games being 'Aerial Derby' and 'Loco' as the long narrow board dimension is identical to Aerial Derby and exactly half that of Loco. The other two games are listed separate.

—user summary

Name: Deep Dive
Description:
Take a deep breath and dive into the depths of the sea. Collect the seashells that hide white shiny pearls. The longer you stay underwater, the more seashells you can collect. But beware! If you see a shark, you will have to drop all your seashells and swim for your life.

On their turn, each player does the following:
• Rolls the color dice
• Dives into the water of the same color as the rolled out color
of the dice, i.e. the player puts his/her diver into the section of water that has the same color as the rolled out color.
• Takes as many seashells as depicted on the water section he/she has just dived in, and places the tokens in front of him/her shell side up (leave closed, no peeking inside the shell!).

Once all the players have dived into the water and collected their seashells, it’s the starting player’s turn again. This time, the starting player rolls the shark dice. All the players keep an eye out for the shark. The shark swims into the water section of the same color as the rolled out color on the shark dice, and scares away all the divers from that section. The players who had their divers in the water section to which the shark came lose all the seashells they had collected (which are closed).The game ends when four seashells with black pearls are found and opened.

-description from publisher

Name: Loco
Description:
The Game of Loco is one of a trio of games from Chad Valley's Kompactum Edition, circa 1910.

A simple roll and move sees players leave one of three railway stations in London and race through the English towns and countryside to finish in Edinburgh. Along the way the players can be hampered or favoured by landing on specific squares. First to reach Edinburgh is the winner.

The Kompactum Edition version of this game probably came boxed with two other Chad Valley games being 'Aerial Derby' and 'Rescue' as the board dimension is exactly double that of 'Aerial Derby' and 'Rescue. The other two games are listed separate.

—user summary

Name: UFO Boom
Description:
Today our galaxy has been turned upside down. The aliens were in a hurry to leave for an important meeting when… suddenly their spaceship broke down. The aliens jumped out of the spaceship confused, and helpless. What should they do? They have to meet with the other aliens as soon as possible. Please help them!

Game play: When it’s your turn, you must try to bring together the two aliens depicted on the card to the same square on the board. When you complete this task, you can flip the card over face down (the card is yours). Then, you can take a new card from the stack and place it face up in front of yourself. The player who is the last to have seen a starry night sky begins the game. The players take turns clockwise. On his/her turn, a player rolls the dice and makes a move according to the dice symbol.

Goal: The first player to collect 5 alien cards and flip them face down will be the winner. This ends the game. The player can flip the card face down only after he/she completes the task pictured on the card (brings both aliens depicted in the card together on the same square).

-description from publisher

Name: Tree Hotel
Description:
In Tree Hotel, each player tries to be the first to fill all the empty slots in his tree with guests. Some guests come voluntarily, others must be lured in with red berries, but beware of the insatiable racoon that steals all your red berries. And watch out for the grim brown bear that adores frightening single animals away from your hotel!

Game play: Place a Tree Hotel in front of each player. Shuffle the cards and place them face down, as common draw pile, in the middle of the table. Foresee some space for the common discard pile, the personal berry stashes, as well as the personal discard piles that will be generated during the game. Starting with the first player, you take turns clockwise. Draw the top card from the common draw pile, flip it over, and make sure everybody sees it.

Goal: Be the first to accommodate 3 pairs of animals in your Tree Hotel.

-description from publisher

Name: The Isle of Cats: Promo Pack 2
Description:
This promo introduces the fly swatting Oshax and 1 golden cat rare treasure tile to the game.

Mix these new tiles in with your existing tiles for an even wider selection of options as you play the game.

This promo was first given out in "Promo Pack C" for the 2021 Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign.

Name: The Isle of Cats: Promo Pack 1
Description:
This promo introduces the curious Oshax and 1 Earthshaker rare treasure tile to the game.

Mix these new tiles in with your existing tiles for an even wider selection of options as you play the game.

Name: KeyForge: Dark Tidings – Archon Deck
Description:
Dive beneath the waves of the Crucible’s oceans with Dark Tidings, the fifth set of Archon Decks for Keyforge, the world’s only Unique Deck Game! Dark Tidings introduces a brand-new House to the game: the Unfathamable. Replacing Dis in the current cardpool, the Unfathomable specialize in controlling their opponents by exhausting enemy creatures. What’s more, every House gains the power to call upon the tides of the Crucible, gaining advantages from high tide and avoiding the punishments of low tide. Finally, Dark Tidings also brings the possibility of evil twin decks in existence, except with many of its cards exchanged for their “evil twin” versions, featuring alternative abilities, graphic design & art.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ticket to Ride: Europe – 15th Anniversary
Description:
Ticket to Ride: Europe – 15th Anniversary contains material from the Ticket to Ride: Europe base game and only the tickets from Europa 1912 expansion for a total of 108 destination ticket cards.

In Ticket to Ride: Europe, you collect cards of various types of train cars that you then use to claim railway routes in Europe. The longer the routes, the more points you earn! If you fulfill destination tickets — goal cards that connect distant cities — then you receive bonus points at the end of the game; fail to connect the cities on your tickets with rail routes, and you lose those points instead.

Name: In Windes Eule
Description:
At breakneck speed, all players simultaneously distribute their animal cards over seven areas. Because different animals are always in demand in each landscape, lightning fast re-thinking is required.

In more detail, each landscape of In Windes Eule has its own laws: In the harbor, only the first animal of each kind can come on board. In the clearing the presence of doubled animals is frowned upon. And in the villages, rats spread a plague that only cats can help against. Everywhere bats, hawks, and flying kites flutter in and over the castle — always ahead of the wind.

—description from the publisher

Name: RISE: A Game of Spreading Evil
Description:
RISE is a dungeon map drawing game that channels the mischevious spirit of Dungeon Keeper, War For The Overworld, and Overlord.

Put into the blood encrusted boots of a Dungeon's Keeper, you will have to build your dungeon, hire minions (and keep them happy), and face all manner of generated nastiness on your way to the surface.

As you explore, you will create a unique dungeon map that builds up organically through prompts and challenges. You will have the chance to raid other realms, fight generated heroes, and chronicle the saga of your rise to power or embarrassing destruction.

On a turn, you explore the map by drawing a playing card to determine what you find, if there is combat, it's simple and turn based. After exploring, you can trade your resources and build your dungeon (rooms, traps and barricades), then you can recruit new units. All of this while keeping your minions' hapinness high enough so there's no mutiny. You win by finding the surface.

Name: Umbra: A Solo Game of Final Frontiers
Description:
UMBRA is a science fiction map drawing game that tasks you with the unenviable task of starting a colony on a hostile alien planet. As the game progresses you will dig into the planet's core in search of an ancient weapon known as The Reaper's Gambit but be warned, no matter how dead a planet looks on the surface, there is always something awful lurking underneath.

Inspired by Rimworld, Startopia, and various sci-fi horrors like Alien, The Thing, Predator, but don't worry, for all the horror on display UMBRA lets you take the lead on what your colony will look like and what your story will be.

After choosing what kind of planet you land on, you explore by drawing a playing card to determine what you find on each turn, if there is combat, it's simple and turn based. After exploring, you can trade your resources and build your colony (rooms and security systems), then you can recruit new units. You also need to balance foond and power so your colony survives. You win by finding the Reaper's Gambit, a special alien weapon that might be saving your species.
Families: Game: Umbra – A Solo Game of Final Frontiers

Name: Ten Suns: Gank Crossover Promo Pack
Description: This pack is a Limited Edition crossover of 4 characters from another game by Medieval Lords studio titled Gank, to be used in the game Ten Suns. Includes Monk as Dharma, Alchemist as Wenchang Wang, Pugilist as Peony Fairy, and Hydra as Xiang Liu.

Name: Agricola: Consul Dirigens Deck
Description:
The Agricola: Consul Dirigens Deck contains 120 new cards for Agricola (Revised Edition): a set of 96 cards comprising the missing numbers from the Corbarius and Dulcinaria decks, and 24 bonus cards. The base game rules remain unchanged.

The Consul Dirigens (or short, CD) deck contains 96 of the 120 cards that have been previously published with the Wizkidz miniatures. The remaining 24 Wizkidz cards are contained in the Corbarius (C) and Dulcinaria (D) decks, which each contain 108 new cards and 12 from the Wizkidz decks.

Name: 7 Fallen
Description:
Seven Fallen is a Fantasy collectible card game from France. In the story of Sevenfall, there are 7 kingdoms fighting for domination of the world.  Initially released in 2020 under the name "Les 7 Royaumes".

You play as a Divinity and your goal is to destroy your opponent with your best army of Angels and Golems. The first goal of the game is to include the players into the process of rules creation and gameplay.

100% of the cards can be played and considered in a deckbuild. There is no vanilla cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Soudruhu, nezlob se!
Description:
The players start at the center and follow the spiral path around the game board. Movement is determined by a die. Along the way the players join the communist party, earn money and are promoted to general secretary. On some spaces the players have to draw cards that benefit or hinder the players. The first player to change his money into 50.000,- Deutsche Mark and defects to western Germany wins the game. Comrade, don't be cross!

—user summary

Name: Kreuz und quer
Description:
The players place their meeples on the starting spaces of their color (or colors). The goal of the game is to reach the starting spaces across the board. Friendly players move in opposite directions, while the opponents move sideways. Movement is one space straight ahead. Opponent meeples may be thrown out and then have to start anew. Friendly meeples may be simply jumped over. The first player to get all his meeples on the destination spaces wins the game.

—user summary

Name: SOPWWID
Description:
SOPWWID, a Solitaire One Page World War I Dogfight game has an extremely low footprint, minimal components, and simple rules.  The entire game fits on one piece of paper, front and back.  Also needed are 11 coins (1 penny, 5 dimes and 5 nickels or any other set of coins), and 1d10.  Alternately, you may print plane images (included) instead of using coins.

The goal is to shoot down as many enemy planes with your Sopwith Camel before being shot down yourself.

Each turn, you'll maneuver your Sopwith by selecting from 1 of 31 hex movement options.  Then the AI will maneuver each enemy plane (both Fokkers and Pfalzes) by a roll of a die.  Although random, the available movement options vary given the relative position of your Sopwith to the enemy.  As a result, the enemy AI is eerily accurate, meaning the enemy is quite effective at hunting you down.

Then every plane shoots in a straight hex row if it has an enemy in its sites.  Your Sopwith has a range of 4 hexes, the Fokkers may shoot 3 hexes, and the Pfalzes shoot 2.

Every plane is shot down on it's second hit.  Fokkers are worth 10 points, Pfalzes 5 points, and if your Sopwith is shot down, you are out.

If you survive the first wave of 1 Fokker and 1 Pfalz, each successive wave adds 1 additional Fokker and 1 additional Pfalz.  [The designers record is 55 points!]

Name: Svago Mania: Campioni d'Europa – La Finale
Description:
Campioni d'Europa: La Finale is a football simulation with magnetic players and metallic balls.

Flick to move, push to shoot !

Attackers can move, pass or shoot.
Defenders can move, attempt to tackle, or, for the goalie, try to save goals.

Name: Captain Sonar: Bermuda Triangle Map
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack E from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

"If you activate SONAR or DRONE and your adversary is on a mist spot of the Bermuda Triangle:
The energy is spent but your adversary must simply answer, 'We are in the mist,' and give no information at all!"

Name: Dragons Wild
Description:
A fast playing card game based on Rummy, with a deck of 1-8 number cards in 8 suits, each a different mythical creature, plus 6 wild Dragon cards.  Play a set or run of cards (meld) or play onto another meld. Score points for the number of cards you play - the multiplier decreases each round, so play as soon as you can for maximum points. The hard part is only being able to put cards in/on one meld each round. Buy the card you need by taking a penalty. Slap down a Wild to finish a meld or for extra points, but don't get stuck with one at the end!

Family friendly and a light game that can be played while waiting for takeaways or another game to finish.  Play with two packs to expand to 7-10 players!

—description from the designer

Name: Flank!: Battle for Fairfield
Description:
The small border town of Fairfield is flanked on both sides by armies both claiming the town's riches.

Flank! is a light hearted strategy game for you and a mate.
Upgrade your warriors with Honors, flank your enemies and shout War Cries as you charge into battle!

On your turn you draw War Cry cards, select an Honor tile to upgrade one of your warriors, move your pieces into flanking positions and then fight your foes.
Fighting involves playing War Cry cards to turn the tides of battle and rolling dice based on the abilities of your pieces and those which are flanking your enemies.

Without a leader an army will fall and by defeating your opponents Champion you win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: La Última Enfermera
Description:
La Última Enfermera is a game about the "crazy" work that nurses usually have to do. At this game each player represents a nurse at a job center, and one day they are called to start a work at the hospital on a random medical field, where they have to fulfill tasks.

At the beginning of the game each player is given a secret Identity Card (each of them related to a different field where you can work at, and each of them of different colour).

A deck is then formed with all the other cards (Task, Situation, Character and Item cards) shuffled. Each turn the player on turn has to draw a new card from the deck, add it to his hand (unless it's a Situation card, in which case it's resolved inmediately. Usually it's an event which changes something on the game, like shuffling all Identity cards of the players and re-dealing at random), and finally has to play or discard one card from it's hand.


     Task cards can only be played (face down near the Identity card of that player) if it's a task of that type of work (it's of the same colour). If the card doesn't match your Identity card colour it has to be discarded.
     Characters and Items are played to make it's special action.


The first player to have 5 Task cards of it's colour wins the game.

Name: BushPoo
Description:
Play the third most popular locally created game in Darwin Australia! 
You and your group of fellow travelers have spent a glorious day of climbing together, but now that you have reached the halfway point to the top of Mt Magnificent you have a huge problem.

That Big Breakfast you all enjoyed before setting out? Well the beans were a bit dodgy, and now everybody in the group needs to do a poo urgently.

Luckily there is a public toilet at the top of the mountain, but now you and your friends are going to have race to the top because if you don’t make it to the toilet in time you’re going to have to do a ...BushPoo!

In Bush Poo you and up to three of your friends will compete to be the first to the Golden throne at the top of the mountain. 
Each turn you will be able to choose between moving one space, or moving two spaces, but be careful. When you move two spaces you must discard two cards from the deck of poo cards, and this can cause the game to end before anyone gets to the top!

When the Poo deck is down to the last five cards the game can end at any moment, because hidden in those last five cards is the poo explosion card! When the poo Explosion card is drawn the game ends, and the player that drew that card looses 5 points!
However, If you’re the first to make it to the golden toilet, and nobody draws the poo explosion card the Game ends and you get 10 points!

But that’s not the only way to get points and win the game. Look out for the leaf collection spaces. Whenever you move your pawn to a leaf collection spot you can draw the indicated number of leaf tokens from the token bag.

But Watch out, because you might draw a poo token! That means you must take a card from the poo card deck. Many of these cards are bad luck. some of the cards are helpful, and some of them are just fun.

-description from designer

Name: Anachrony Chess
Description:
In an alternate universe, the Paths of Anachrony are at war. This abstract, chess-style, two-player strategy game tells the story of one Path’s conquest of another, using Anachrony components and a print-and-play game board.

Just like in chess, your goal is to capture your opponent’s “King,” which in this game is represented by the Player banner—in other words, the Path’s “Flag.”

In this chess variant, the playing pieces will be your Exosuits, and the Workers you use to operate them will determine how they behave. What do you need for the next move? A Knight, a Rook, a Bishop, or maybe a Queen? Recruit the respective Worker from the Market for your chosen Exosuit with a bonus resource (like a Water or Energy core), and make your move!

Keep in mind that Workers are removed from used Exosuits after they move, so you’ll have to recruit new ones to operate them—unless, of course, you pay a Water to motivate the Worker to stay. If you have an empty Exosuit in danger or would like to move an Exosuit like a Pawn, you’ll find Energy cores are quite useful as well.

The print-and-play Anachrony Chess game board and the Rulebook are available for download at www.mindclashgames.com and the Files section of this BGG page.

Name: Conference
Description:
Like the famous Kalah or bean game, Conference is a game for two. The game is played in the box with a casino made of velvet-covered plastic. The "beans" consist of 36 wooden discs that are embossed on one side with a coat of arms.

—user summary

Name: Jet + Boccia
Description:
The two games of skill "Jet" and "Boccia" are included. "Boccia" is the famous French national game "Boule" brought to the gaming table. The game is played with a plastic figure, one arm of which is movably attached to roll the ball across the fairway to the target ball. With "Jet" it is important to roll your balls with the throwing figure into fields with as many points as possible.

—user summary

Name: Crimson Company: Wildwood Tales
Description:
The Wildwood Tales expansion adds a new set of mystical creatures to the Crimson Company roster. It also includes a 5-card set of vanilla cards without effects to make it easier to introduce new players to the game.

In Crimson Company, two opposing players take on the roles of adventurous noblemen in a cut-throat fantasy world. In a battle of wits, they assemble armies of sellswords, from hardened warriors and shady merchants to mythical creatures as old as time.

Your goal in a match of Crimson Company is to conquer two of the three castles in the center. You conquer a castle by amassing more strength than your opponent in the castle's lane by the time that lane is scored. A lane is scored once a player owns at least four cards in it.

Cards represent a large variety of characters, all of which have specific strength values and unique effects. The latter are either one-time instant effects that happen when a card is played, or they are triggered in specific phases of the game. Four randomly drawn cards from the character deck are "on offer". You may bid coins on only one of those at a time. Then your opponent decides to either pay you off, doubling the coins you bid, or pass and let you play the card.

-description from designer

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Gnome Gunner
Description:
A new item card for Battle for Greyport.

The promo card comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 2

Damage: 0
Title: Gnome Gunner
Type: Physical
Text Box:
Now ability: Snipe green die
Anytime ability: + Hero
Recruitment Cost: Silver Coin

Name: Formula BoardGame
Description:
Formula Board Game is a competitive, strategic / management board game for 2-5 players, which allows you to take part in a race of the highest car competition, reliving all the emotions of a Grand Prix.

The game simulates all aspects of a car race, acceleration and deceleration of the car, race strategy, pit stops, overtaking, variable weather, tire choice, crashes and of course damage.
In addition, the player through tokens has additional abilities such as sudden braking, instinct and additional gear changes, while through action cards that he can play during the turn, he adds attacks such as, risky overtaking, slipstreaming and delayed braking.

The game includes both the main cars of the players and the BotCars (cars that move independently during the race through special cards), each player controls an entire team during the race, then 2 cars, the main player car, which moves with its gear cards and the corresponding BotCar which moves autonomously, but which the player can help with additional movements through action cards.

Before starting the race, players will have to qualify for their main car, these are done through an application for Android smartphones, this is an absolute novelty in car racing themed board games, because it allows the player to actively interact , as the latter has to show his reaction skills to make the best qualifying time.

Subsequently, the team consisting of the 2 cars is purchased through an auction.
Subsequently the players, always through the Android application, will have to carry out a skill test to make the first movement of the departure, also this absolute novelty, which allows the player to simulate in a realistic way the emotion of the departure when the traffic light goes off.

The game takes place in several rounds, each round consists of 3 rounds, where the players must simultaneously place 3 marching cards in front of them in a secret way, respecting the acceleration and deceleration movement rules based on the weather. For example, with the sun weather the acceleration is maximum +3 and the deceleration is maximum -2, with rain weather it is maximum +2 and the deceleration is maximum -2, but they must also pay attention to the entry and exit limits. always turns according to the weather.

During the race the BotCar cars are always in play, even if you play with 2 players, so you will always have a minimum of 7 cars in the race and a maximum of 10 cars if you play with 5.

The game is a simulation, luck is totally non-existent, the 10 moving gear cards that the player has in his hand are the same for all players, so only the player's strategic skill can lead to victory.

The race ends when all the cars in the last round have crossed the finish line, the winner will be established according to the sum of the points scored by the 2 cars of the team calculated based on the finish position.


Formula Board Game è un gioco da tavolo competitivo, strategico/gestionale per 2-5 giocatori, che permette di prendere parte ad una gara della massima competizione automobilistica, rivivendo tutte le emozioni di un Gran Premio.
Il gioco simula tutti gli aspetti di una gara automobilistica, accelerazione e decelerazione della macchina, la strategia di gara, i pit stop, i sorpassi, il meteo variabile, la scelta degli pneumatici, incidenti e ovviamente i danni.
Inoltre il giocatore attraverso dei token ha delle abilità aggiuntive come frenata improvvisa, istinto e cambi marcia aggiuntivi, mentre attraverso delle carte azione che può giocare durante il turno, aggiunge attacchi come, sorpassi azzardati, la scia e la staccata ritardata.
Il gioco comprende sia le auto principali dei giocatori, sia le BotCar (auto che si muovono autonomamente durante la gara attraverso delle carte apposite), ogni giocatore controlla durante la gara un team intero, quindi 2 auto, l'auto principale giocatore, che muove con le sue carte marcia e la BotCar corrispondente che si muove autonomamente, ma che il giocatore può aiutare con dei movimenti aggiuntivi attraverso le carte azione.
Prima di iniziare la gara i giocatori dovranno effettuare le qualifiche per la propria auto principale, queste vengono effettuate attraverso un'applicazione per smartphone Android, questa è un'assoluta novità nei giochi da tavolo a tema corse automobilistiche, perché permette al giocatore di interagire attivamente, in quanto quest'ultimo deve dare prova delle sue abilità di reazione per effettuare il miglior tempo di qualifica. 
Successivamente si procede all'acquisto del team composto dalle 2 auto attraverso un'asta. 
Successivamente i giocatori, dovranno effettuare sempre attraverso l'applicazione Android, una prova di abilità per effettuare il primo movimento della partenza, anche questa assoluta novità, che permette al giocatore di simulare in modo realistico l'emozione della partenza allo spegnimento del semaforo.
Il gioco si svolge in vari round, ogni round è formato da 3 turni, dove i giocatori contemporaneamente devono posizionare davanti a se 3 carte marcia in maniera segreta, rispettando le regole movimento di accelerazione e decelerazione in base al meteo. Ad esempio con il meteo sole l'accelerazione è di massimo +3 e la decelerazione e di massimo -2, con meteo pioggia è di massimo +2 e la decelerazione di massimo -2, ma devono fare anche attenzione ai limiti di entrata e uscita curva sempre in base al meteo.
Durante la gara le auto BotCar sono sempre in gioco, anche se si gioca in 2 giocatori, quindi in gara si avranno sempre un minimo di 7 auto e un massimo di 10 auto se si gioca in 5.
Il gioco è una simulazione, la fortuna è totalmente inesistente, le 10 carte marcia movimento che il giocatore ha in mano sono uguali per tutti i giocatori, quindi solo la bravura strategica del giocatore può portare alla vittoria.
La gara termina quando tutte le auto nell'ultimo round hanno attraversato il traguardo, il vincitore verrà stabilito secondo la somma dei punti effettuati dalle 2 auto del team calcolati in base alla posizione di arrivo.

Name: Metro: City Edition
Description: 20th Anniversary edition of Metro, with 6 new City Expansions - Berlin, London, New York, Paris, St Petersburg, and Stockholm.

Name: Peníze: Jak rozmnožit peníze
Description:
Peníze ("Money") is a management game in which real Czech companies and banks are included. The rules of the game respect the laws of real business and securities trading. The game shows what economic conditions affect the values of securities, for which companies are better bet on dividends and for which it is worth speculating to buy and sell shares.

Players roll dice, then they move figure by that many spaces. When they enter company area, you check actual state of game, find of how much company dividents rise or decrease, then they can buy them.
When game ends players decide before actual game starts. Players can agree that game end at 2 hour timer and who will own most of money wins or they can agree on money limit to reach for win.

Peníze jsou manaÅ¾erská hra, ve které jsou obsaÅ¾eny skuteÄné Äeské firmy a banky. Pravidla hry respektují zákonitosti reálného podnikání a obchodování s cennými papíry. Hra ukazuje, jaké ekonomické podmínky ovlivÅˆují hodnoty cenných papírÅ¯, u kterých podnikÅ¯ je lépe vsadit na dividendy a u kterých se vyplatí spekulovat s koupí a prodejem akcií.

HráÄi házejí kostkami a poté o tolik míst posouvají figurku. KdyÅ¾ vstoupí do oblasti spoleÄnosti, zkontrolujete skuteÄný stav hry, zjistíte, o kolik se dividendy spoleÄnosti zvýší nebo sníÅ¾í, a pak si je mohou koupit.
Po skonÄení hry se hráÄi rozhodnou pÅ™ed zahájením skuteÄné hry. HráÄi se mohou dohodnout, Å¾e hra konÄí ve 2hodinovém ÄasovaÄi a kdo bude vlastnit vÄ›tšinu penÄ›z, vyhrává, nebo se mohou dohodnout na penÄ›Å¾ním limitu, aby dosáhli na výhru.

Name: Elbűvölő Magyarország kvízjáték
Description:
A game of amazing curiosities and essential knowledge that will build on the well-known Trivia board games. A variety of questions await the player!

What are the things everyone needs to know about their homeland? Put yourself to the test with the enchanting Hungary quiz game, which guides you through cultures, from the best-known traditions and sayings to the most interesting facts, if you go through different topics!

Topics:

History
Culture
Science and nature
Geography
Sports
Mixed
Plant the whole family for a new, shared experience where everyone can learn something.
How much are you in the picture?

Everyone plays at once, so no one gets bored!
Multiple choice puzzles to make fun for everyone!

Name: Elbűvölő Magyarország Junior
Description:
A version of the famous Glamorous Hungary quiz game for younger children! We recommend the game from the age of 7

How well do you know your homeland? Lots of little things are subconsciously built from our culture into our personalities, but there are even more things worth knowing about our home with a thousand faces! Here is a great opportunity to discover Hungary and stand out from the others with your knowledge, gaining the glorious victory! Test yourself on 6 different topics, answer correctly and pocket the points! Quiz up!

Sit down with the whole family for a new, shared experience where everyone can learn something.
How much are you in the picture?

Everyone plays at once, so no one gets bored!
Multiple choice puzzles to make fun for everyone!

Name: #Maradj Otthon!
Description:
#Maradj otthon! ("Stay Home") is a simple and fast-paced party game that is great fun for all ages. The original game was created by Ms. Lenhardt Kwaysser Fatime, winner of the 2020 Super Teacher Award, during her quarantine for her own class, and was later further developed with the help of the Blue Game. The year 2020 has left us with a lot of bad feelings and memories, but it is important that we can laugh despite the difficulties.

The goal of the game, which can be played by 2-6 people, is to preserve our cold blood and overcome the obstacles in front of us in the constantly changing conditions. Collect all 19 points! During the game, they could step on a special game board that could change at any moment, creating a whole new situation for the players. When collecting points, don't forget about the mask and hand sanitizer! Funny quarantine cards will help or hinder us during our mission.

If we come together from time to time to defeat the virus together, we can also play with the semi-cooperative game mode: here too we collect points for ourselves, but in the meantime we also have to pay close attention to the threatening virus so that it does not outgrow us! We can only defeat it by working together together if we are willing to make sacrifices and give up the points we have already earned. In the game, we tried to smuggle a lot of humor in addition to the current problems, to solve the limitations and annoyances of everyday life.

Masks produced, have fun!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Brúnó Budapesten: Városnézés
Description:
The Sightseeing board game presents Budapest to the preschool and primary school age group on four large boards. It is the smallest of the four games of different difficulty and theme, and those who can already read will find it age-appropriate. The game guides both Budapesters and non-Budapesters through the capital.

The Brúnó in Budapest board game contains 4 different games that are related to the book series Brúnó in Budapest.

The rules are simple and easy to follow in all 4 games and can be played in an average of 15-20 minutes.

Simplified, Erika Bartos's drawings introduce children to Budapest's famous buildings and public spaces in a perfectly recognizable way. The game is also suitable for children who like transport and means of transport.

The cube-based vehicle game is easy even for the little ones: the winner is the first to collect the six vehicles.

The second board is a classic party, where the winner will be the first to get from Vajdahunyad Castle to the Elizabeth Lookout Tower.

In the third game, we have to go around the border of the capital, and the surrounding settlements and the building drawings on the map and the numbers and boundaries of the districts help to get to know our capital.

The fourth answer table builds on the knowledge of Budapest.

The game is recommended for 3-10 year olds. It can be played by 2 to 8 players.

Name: The Pratzen: Austerlitz, 1805
Description:
The Pratzen: Austerlitz, 1805 is a two-player Tactical level board-wargame that portrays the fighting on and around the Pratzen Heights at the Battle of Austerlitz. The battle was fought between the French forces of Napoleon Bonaparte and a larger allied army composed of Austrian and Russian forces. The battle is considered to be one of the most important and decisive engagements of the Napoleonic Wars. The engagement result brought the War of the Third Coalition to an end and about the Treaty of Pressburg. The battle is widely thought of as a tactical masterpiece on par with Cannae.

The game is designed by industry veteran and author of The Art of Wargaming, Peter P. Perla. The game system of The Pratzen: Austerlitz, 1805 began some three decades ago as an idea to update the classic SPI Tactical wargame Grenadier, published in 1971. Pratzen evolved into a merger of the Grenadier scale with some different combat mechanics based on the original von Reisswitz Kriegsspiel rules of 1824, adopted as a training tool in the Prussian army after the Napoleonic Wars. The scale was shifted from half-battalions to companies and divisions as the basic infantry maneuver piece, and much additional streamlining and simplification ensued.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Carcassonne: 20th Anniversary Edition
Description:
Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of their meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

During a game of Carcassonne, players are faced with decisions like: "Is it really worth putting my last meeple there?" or "Should I use this tile to expand my city, or should I place it near my opponent instead, giving him a hard time to complete their project and score points?" Since players place only one tile and have the option to place one meeple on it, turns proceed quickly even if it is a game full of options and possibilities.

Carcassonne: 20th Anniversary Edition is a special edition of Carcassonne to celebrate the 20th anniversary of its Spiel des Jahres win in 2001. This edition includes the tiles from the Carcassonne base game, "The River" mini-expansion (with five new river tiles), "The Abbot" mini-expansion, and a new 15-tile "anniversary" mini-expansion. All tiles are adorned with UV-print, with many detailed easter eggs being hidden in the art. Costume stickers are included in case you wish to "dress" your meeples.

All contents are compatible with existing and future Carcassonne releases.

Name: Liberation: Moon of Mystery
Description:
The Athena Colony isn't quite what it seems. Disguised as a run of the mill spaceport...

A 2-card expansion that introduces a new map card and a new ability.

Name: Trumpopoly: The Geopolitical Board Game
Description:
An exciting new game in which you collect electors, buy states and collect electoral votes to win the White House.

The game features intelligently designed board squares along with two types of cards.  VOTE cards are pulled at every turn, resulting in gain or loss of electors. MAGA cards have various social and political circumstances which affect your candidate.

The game rules intelligently integrate the game elements in a way that creates levels of decision making. This includes buy no buy decisions for states, strategy for dice rolls and decisions about swing states

The game includes funny plot twists like getting a “Rudy” card to avoid an indictment and creatively designed elector dollars festooned with electoral colleges members. Future plans include expansion packs for each election, including cards designed around the political social climate and events of that time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hats On
Description:
This is a simple children's dice game. Move around a board to acquire clothes and be the first person to dress a figure.

Players select an underwear clad male or female two dimensional figure and must add six pieces of clothing: shirt; trousers/skirt/shorts; sock; shoes; sweater; and a hat.

The game comes with multiple clothing variants, as well as a blank template for users to create their own.

—user summary

Name: Comment Below...
Description:
A rotating judge places a Status card on top of their chosen profile card while the rest of the group competes to play the funniest Comment card. Once everyone has submitted their chosen comment card face down, the judge awards a point to the funniest one. The person who has the most status states at the end of the game is the winner.

Contains: 75 Profile cards, 90 Status cards, 270 Comment cards, a super fancy easel, plus instructions.

Name: Clank!: Tower of Babble
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack E from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Device (purple)

Cost 3

Use: Place this near you with 3 cubes from your supply.
You may move one to the Clank! area to gain 1 Skill.
When this is empty, trash it.

Name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Menagerie
Description:
During a mission into enemy territory, the rangers are ambushed by a strange assortment of wild beasts, pursued by their Shadow Deep handlers. Can the rangers survive the onslaught, and then turn the tables on their attackers? And can they discover the secrets of the enemy wagon train before it escapes back into the darkness?

Rangers of Shadow Deep: Menagerie is a mini-supplement featuring one mission with two scenarios. Also included are nine new animal companions that rangers can recruit to join them on their adventures.

Name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – King Hsss on Tyrantisaurus
Description:
King Hsss rides into battle atop a Tyrantisaurus, armed with a shoulder-mounted cannon and razor-sharp teeth. When the techno-organic virus spread through Eternia, the dinosaur that lived there began to grow robotic limbs and weapons.

Package contains:

1x King Hsss on Tyrantisaurus limited miniature with scenic base integrated
1x game card

Item is available in Europe only.
Families: Game: Masters of the Universe – Fields of Eternia

Name: Monopoly: Fribourg / Freiburg
Description:
Monopoly, the world famous land and real estate game, takes you through the beautiful old town of Fribourg. Listening to the two native languages, lingering comfortably in a medieval city or enjoying one of the most beautiful views into the distance from the 74 meter high cathedral tower - this can only be done in Fribourg. But go on a journey of discovery yourself.

You dreamed of owning the Saint-Nicolas cathedral, building a hotel in Courtepin or buying the Dent-de-Broc? Players can buy the St. Nicholas Cathedral, the Poya Bridge or Lake Murten.

Only 3500 editions made and it is in French and German.

Name: Monopoly: Vaud
Description:
Monopoly, the world famous land and real estate game, takes you through the canton of Vaud. 
You dreamed of owning the Chaplin museum, building a hotel on the Glacier 3000 ? 
Players can buy the golf course of Villars, the towns of Nyon, Montreux or Vevey, or even the castle of Aigle. Be careful to avoid the Bois-Mermet prison though!

Name: Flames of War: Firestorm Campaign – Cherbourg & St. Lô, Normandy part II
Description:
Firestorm: Cherbourg & St. Lô covers the US Sector of the Normandy campaign.

Firestorm campaigns give players the opportunity to play Flames Of War games in a larger context and give every game a greater meaning.

Name: Lottery Fever
Description:
The object of the game is to either accumulate $1 million in winnings or match all six "Big Deal Lotto" numbers on their card.

Each player takes one score card that has three lottery games on it: Triple Play, 4-Play and Big Deal Lotto. They are then given $40,000 to start play.

Through rolling a die and moving around the board, players can play various lottery games in an effort to accumulate the $1 million goal, or earn or lose money on event spaces (i.e. - Auto Accident, Pay College Tuition, Inheritance, etc.). On each of those spaces, the amount won or lost is determined by the number they roll after landing on the space. If a player cannot afford to pay a penalty, they can either pay what they have or pay nothing and miss their next turn, but no player is ever eliminated from the game.

In Triple Play, a player pays $400 to the bank and chooses one of the Triple Play number sets on their card and roll three dice up to three times trying to match those numbers. If successful, their winnings are based on how many turns it took out of the three to match the numbers. If they are unsuccessful, they win nothing and their turn is over.

4-Play is the same as Triple Play, but with higher payouts, and the player rolls four dice up to four times. They also pay $500 to play it.

Big Deal Lotto requires a $1,000 payment, and the player rolls one die. If the roll matches a number on their card, they cover it with a chip and and are on step closer to winning.

Players may also join in on another player's lottery by being the first to shout "Big Money", but risk paying that player if they are unsuccessful in the lottery being played. There is also an "Investment" space where players can put up between $1,000 and $10,000 in an effort to multiply their winnings.

For a longer game, winning requires a player to both acquire at least $1 million, as well as match all six of their Big Deal Lotto numbers.

Name: D100 Dungeon: The Dragons Return
Description:
D100 Dungeon: The Dragons Return contains campaign quest 2 which is set in the continent of Westpoint. It is the second campaign book released for D100 Dungeon and follows on from the campaign named “The Goblin and the Goblet”, which features in the Adventurers Companion book.

Also included is Martial Artistry that combines new advanced weaponry and unarmed combat, and a new Encounter table EB with 36 new monsters and a new Monster Ability. The new table incorporates the two previously released Encounter tables (E and EA) so you can experience a highly varied range of monsters in your games.

—description from the designer

Name: Aristeia! All-In-One
Description:
The All-In-One box includes the Aristeia! Core Box and the Prime Time box, the expansion that adds all the rules and necessary materials to allow up to 4 players to join the fun, and new scenarios and Aristeia-compatible game elements, such as objective cards, running projectiles and more.

Contents:
Aristeia Core Box
  â€£ 8 Assembled Plastic Minis
  â€£ 14 Custom Dice
  â€£ 1 Double-sided Game Board
  â€£ 2 Control Panels
  â€£ 60 Standard Cards
  â€£ 8 Mini Cards
  â€£ 3 Booklets
  â€£ 130+ Markers & Tokens
Prime Time Expansion
  â€£ 1 Double-sided Game Board
  â€£ 1 Running Orders Panel
  â€£ 4 Control Panels
  â€£ 80 Standard Tactics
  â€£ 48 Objective Cards
  â€£ 81 Markers & Tokens
  â€£ 1 Booklet

Name: Fish and Ships
Description:
Fish n’ Ships is a multiplayer card game about marine conservation: fish in a sustainable way in your sea in order to obtain more points than the other players for cards in the sea and cards of caught species.
The game reproduces the Adriatic and Mediterranean marine food web and fisheries complexity.
There are 36 different species divided into 4 groups based on their position in the food chain (Trophic level): producers (green cards), primary consumers (yellow cards), secondary consumers (orange cards) , tertiary consumers (red cards).
In the first phase of the game the players have to “build” their marine ecosystem, in which there must be organisms from all trophic levels.
A player with a healthy sea (i.e. with at least one red card) can start the second phase of the game: use the fishing cards to fish in the player’s own sea.
Every player starts having eight fishing cards, each one corresponding to a fishing technique commonly used in Adriatic Sea, with their target species and secondary effects on habitat.
There are other cards related to human activities or natural events that may affect the game (bonus, malus).
Points are assigned based on the healthy status of the player’s sea and on how he fished in a sustainable way.

The game is part of the Interreg project FAIRSEA (Fisheries in the AdriatIc Region - a Shared Ecosystem Approach), which objective is to enhance the conditions for implementing innovative approaches in the sector of sustainable fisheries management in the Adriatic Sea.

—description from the designer

Name: KYNG Pirate Dice
Description:
Our take on the classic South American game; Peruvian Lying Dice.

1-X players.

Roll your own dice but keep them hidden from other players as you take turns making bets on everyone’s dice.

Get caught in a lie and you lose a die!

When you’re done to your last die, special rules kick in to help you make a comeback.

Lose your last die and you’re out.

Last player left in the game is the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: La Taja
Description:
A night in a bar with friends. Your objective is to get drunk (catch "La Taja") before the rest of the players, adding and subtracting "taja" points. The taja points needed to win varies depending on the amount of players.

Set collection card game with Drink cards to get taja points, refreshment cards to reduce your oponent taja points and action cards to interact between players.
